line_1: Blessings which only to the anguish add;
line_2: Why wilt thou, torturing reflection, mad
The Lord is great and glad.

line_1: To these, how many proofs I yet could add,
line_2: That man's superior sense is being mad?

line_1: Gorgonian terrors to each mien I add,
line_2: And still their weakest part with care I shade.

line_1: Nor can Art an embellishment add
line_2: Thee Nature with beauty has clad,

line_1: And graced with all philosophy can add,
line_2: That man in nature's richest mantle clad,

line_1: A frantic fever you may add,
line_2: Most authors make their lovers mad;
